text:

I tried very hard to keep a positive relationship with this practice, but they refused to uphold excellent customer service.

Best

text: I've been to a number of dermatologists over my lifetime, but Dr. Hartman is hands down the best of the best. He is extremely thorough and spends time addressing all my concerns. text: Amazing experience. I was in and out of the office in 20 minutes! Dr. Youhn and Christa were amazing. She was so friendly and made the whole experience enjoyable and painless! She has resorted so much more confidence in myself from getting rid of a beauty mark I had ever since I was a kid. I highly recommend this place!!!

Also, in my 16 year experience, someone who was serious about skin care and procedures would not mind paying the $100 consultation fee to come into the office to discuss these things like an adult.

name: Brannigan Keller
text:
Edited from a 1 star to a 5 star

My 2 year old child was a new patient and one of his siblings got sick the day of the appointment. I called to try to reschedule and was informed that I would be charged a no show fee. I do not think they could have made me pay the $50 no show fee as I had never been to this business before and more importantly was not aware of this ridiculous amount but called my spouse to make arrangements to go.  Needless to say they lost mine and my families business, I would not recommend them to anyone as my experience is not how to treat customers.

I’ve changed my negative review to a positive one after receiving a phone call from the owner of this practice.  It’s nice that he took the time to call and listen to my concerns while making attempts to set things right. I understand why these “no show” policies have to be in place as I work in the healthcare field as well.  After talking to the owner I would recommend this business.

resp.text: Ms. Keller, Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We apologize that this was your experience. Charging for missed appointments due to illness is not and has never been our policy. Again, we apologize.

name: Doug Merkel
text: Always nice. Front desk back. We do not wait long to be seen. Good location for us.

name: Trina Janay
text: Saw Dr. Rayna Dyck(she was recommended by some people i know personally). & she was horrible. She first off camebin very dry which is a horrible first impression and my attitude immediately was based off of hers and by her attitude being so dry (seemed like she really didn’t want to be at work) it made me not believe anything she said or that she didn’t care to help ...although everything she said might have been true. Her staff though is very sweet. I didn’t get the medication she thought MIGHT help b/c it was pointless to purchase out of pocket if it MIGHT help. And the two reasons she said i might have skin discoloration was definitely not my case. I’m big on reviews & she had a few reviews on her dry attitude but i gave her the benefit of the doubt because i had people who recommended her..obviously b/c she helped their condition & not off her attitude. She was so awkward & dry. Def. appreciate Dr. Hartman for giving me a call about my visit and hopefully i dont have to pay another co-pay when i fu with him b/c today i def. paid a co-pay for no reason at all. and the stars are for the staff and him calling me back def. not for Dr. Dyck.

name: Gillian McCown
text:
Dr. Youhn had the nerve and audacity to tell me that I should wean my son. Last I checked, breastfeeding is outside her scope of practice and she has no business giving professional advice about childcare or breastfeeding to a patient. It is unethical to give advice or direction on any topic professionally outside one’s scope. Breastfeeding and the health and wellness of my son most definitely are.

Updated because they decided to be unprofessional with their response here and on Facebook.

These comments started when I was asked if he was my only one and if I was thinking about having more yet and I said I'm still not sleeping so no. She kept saying should really talk to his ped because he doesn't need to be nursing all night long. At his size he doesn't need to eat at night and he's probably just doing it out of comfort. I didn't ask for sleep advice.
I mean I could understand her saying the nursing could be irritating my issue and that weaning might be something to consider.
But talking about how my son doesn't need to nurse anymore and I should really just talk to his pediatrician about weaning him is way beyond her scope and none of her damn business!
His pediatrician has no problem with it and nursing till 2 is recommended by the WHO.

name: Gina Delbianco
text: The Chelsea office is aweful. I've been taking my daughter's here for skin care for a long time now...mostly because we live in Chelsea and it's convenient. I've decided I've had enough of their extremely snooty, unfriendly staff. We had been seeing Dr. Murphy in this office for years and then one day she just  magically dissapears and is replaced by a different dermatologist with no explanation. Nothing!  Can't stand this office!!  We wiill be moving on to a new dermatologist and hopefully a smiling, friendly and much more upbeat atmosphere!   Alert people! Five minutes after posting this review My phone rings and this man states is name is Dr. Hartman ..and demands to know my reasonings for posting this review! This is just too unreal for me! Skin wellness of Chelsea ...you are sketchy!!!!!!  Ok so now I'm getting harrassing messages from two different area codes regarding this review. I guess Skin wellness pays some crappy people to harrass people that give bad reviews in hopes they will erase it. Not going to happen. You're Chelsea office sucks!....Excuse me! Whoever you are..her name was Brittany and she treated my children's skin problems for years. And please . ..stop texting your profane messsges to my phone!

resp.text: We pride ourselves on being friendly and helpful. We have never employed a doctor named Murphy. Good luck achieving your skin care goals.

name: Sarah Holder
text: Fantastic staff and exceptional providers. The whole team goes above and beyond for their patients!

name: Lillian Byner
text: In response to Dr. Hartman's reply to my review, I appreciate your telephone call. However, as I communicated to you in our conversation last night which you neglected to include in your response, I have waited for a return call to my non-urgent issue way longer than 24-48 hours. My first follow-up appointment where the biopsy was taken was on June 13th, where I was told by a clinician that I would know the results before I left for vacation. I called for results initially 1 or 2 days before I left town June 23rd. I then called back on the 28th, where I was told once again that I would be called back before close of business, yet I was not. I was never informed by any of your staff that I spoke with (both clinical and non-clinical - I have spoken with both) of the 10-14 day timeframe for biopsy results. In speaking with you last night is the first I have heard of the 10-14 day waiting period for results and the results not being discussed until the scheduled follow-up visit. Perhaps some form of training refresher would be useful in ensuring that all of the staff, both clinical and non-clinical are relaying uniform information and setting the proper expectations to the patients. Once again, I appreciate your reaching out to me and I am sorry that I had a less than desirable experience.

text: Went to get my daughters ears pierced the Friday before last. I wouldn’t want her arm pits in my face, so I spared my child that experience. We went to Claire’s and had a great experience with a well dress, kind mannered woman who made my child feel at ease.

name: janell johnson
text: Do not go to this place if you are piercing your yound child's ears. I just left from trying to get my 3 year old daughters ears pierced. She was excited and we let her pick her own earrings out. A nice lady helped us but you could tell she was new and learning. She kept having to ask questions to her supervisors who acted like they were too busy to help her, which ultimately took way longer than what it should have taken to complete the transaction, about 45 mins before we were finally asked to come sit in the chair. By that time my daughter was becoming impatient  and started to get nervous. We went to sit in the chair and she started to freak out. The employees just starred at her. They werent nicely trying to tell her that it would be quick or that it would be okay. They just starred. Previously my husband asked if we could pay after the piercing had been done because we werent sure if our daughter would go through with it. We were told no we had to pay immediately. After a minute of trying to get my daughter to cooperate I asked if we could get a refund. We were told no, they do not do refunds. I asked if we could come back another day after she had time to calm down, again we were told no. HORRIBLE, INCONSIDERATE CUSTOMER SERVICE. We took the earrings we paid for and left.

resp.text: Janell, we are so sorry to hear about this experience and will follow up with our team to address what you've stated here. Thank you for being so open about your visit.

text: Claire's overall has some cute things but it's the ear piercing that worries me. Claire's uses a piercing gun which is not recommended and can damage your cartilage in your ear or on your body. They also say they clean the piercing guns but you can't really sterilize a piercing gun. Be careful and safe, some are lucky, some aren't. P.S. Find a piercing place that uses needles and has professionals. It will be more expensive but I promise you it'll be worth it. Sometimes you have to get surgery depending on how bad the piercing went and that can be over $1000.

name: Emily Wilson
text:
01/16/2021

Claire’s
Shoppes at Bel Air
3464 Joe Treadwell Dr
Mobile, AL 36606

My daughter and I had been looking forward to our ‘Mommy-Daughter’ date for weeks.  Though I think that having your ears pierced is something of a right of passage that should happen in the pre-teen years, a step closer to becoming a young woman, and she is about half that age, I'm a sucker for my little girl and we decided this would be our event for the day.  I researched online and found a few places that were still offering this service despite this pandemic.  We finally landed on Claire's as it appeals to children in her age group.

As an added bonus to the day, my niece, who is just a few years older than my daughter, and my teenage nephew got to come with us.  Big Girl's Day and extra help to keep them wrangled.  We entered the store and asked a young woman sweeping the floor near a large unmarked puddle of water how to get started.  Without lifting her head she replied quickly, “you get in line," and stepped past us to keep sweeping.

Still unsure of what to do, my nephew saw the sign situated nearly above the entrance, something that wouldn't have been seen without guidance or turning around to leave.  After waiting in line for about 30 minutes for the 4 customers ahead of us to be seen, another employee asked for my driver's license.  I explained that I only have the temporary PDF version because I recently renewed it, but it is perfectly legal per Alabama Code.

"We have to have the paper copy," she said.

I argued, "But this is valid."

"I signed a contract for the company that says I have to have a paper copy of your license."

I stared, in awe, that she could say that to two excited young girls without even so much as a fake frown, but kept her face as blank and emotionless as Ben Stein's is when he verbally buries an opponent in a trivia competition.  My daughter's eyes welled with tears.  I quickly assured her that this is not a failed evening because I could call someone to bring their license from home and we could still get it done tonight.

We browsed the thousand's of items for sale while we waited for our help who was only 20 minutes away at most.  The glue-on nails and clearance jewelry was sure to extend the evening's fun.  It was hard to stay focused on the good time, however, when the first woman we spoke with that was sweeping the floors nearly ran into my daughter as she barreled past with a mop, then a few minutes later made a point to put a returned item back on the shelf directly behind my daughters feet, throwing it instead of placing it, and hitting my daughter's ankle.  A simple "sorry" may have helped my growing annoyance, but she said absolutely nothing at all.  Nothing.

Once our help arrived, we cheered together and made our way back to the now empty ear piercing line.  We waited for several minutes, but no one came to help us.  After trying to wave someone down, our hero with the license left us in line to find help.  He was told that they were closing in 10 minutes and needed to mop so they could go home, so they weren't going to do the piercing.

The look of defeat on my daughter broke my heart and while her cousins comforted her, I placed the souvenir's we intended to buy in addition to the starter earrings on the shelf closest to us and wasn't shy about letting my baby girl know that it's ok, and that because of the uncalled for, horrid way they treated us, we will never shop at a Claire's again, and will make the date a weekend long event by going elsewhere to get it done tomorrow.

I wanted to scream.  What purpose did the nasty attitude and horrendous customer service serve for Clarie's or their employees?  But instead of making my darling feel even worse by causing a scene and publicly scolding those wicked-acting women  like I wanted to, I decided to go the route of public shaming and posting our way-less-than-pleasant experience online for others to take into consideration when choosing the best place to share that memory with their babies.

Don't go to Claire's.  They suck.

We live all the way on the outskirts of Leeds. Right after his appointment we ate at Panera, came home & took a nap straight away. That's when I FINALLY realized I'd left it! By then they were closed! And they're closed on Sundays as well! So, I had to wait ALL THE WAY 'til Monday to call and make sure it was there! AND IT WAS! They'd kindly put it up for me until my fiancé went to pick it up! Such kind, respectful, professional individuals! Also, Dawn (hope that's how she spells her name樂) was the one I spoke with on Monday as well as being there when my son had his appointment. Sorry it's such a LONG "review", but it's just MINE and SON'S experience. And I felt as if it needed to be shared. ESPECIALLY if kids are involved. text: I recently got a piercing done here and it was phenomenal. Definitely one of the most professional and clean places that I have visited. Also, everyone is very knowledgeable and helps you through it every step of the way. I could not have picked a better place to have my piercing done.

name: Megan Lee
text:
Let me start with the place was clean and had a nice vibe. I contacted them through Facebook looking to set an appointment for two scoop tongue piercings. I sent them a picture of what I wanted and I was told they could do it. I had to pay a 20 dollar deposit to book my appointment and pay the remainder when I got to the shop. First, I had to pay the remainder before even receiving my service which I can understand but that wasn't on their website, Facebook page or anything. Secondly, when I went back to get my piercing, the lady pulled out the wrong kind of bar. I stated,"that's too small. That's not what I want." I pulled my phone out to show her the pic I sent and she told me" yea we don't have that bar for that piercing." She was very like nonchalant. We kept trying to make small talk and ask
Questions and she just seemed annoyed like she didn't wanna deal with us.  So I became upset, because whoever I was talking to on the Facebook page said y'all could do that piercing. Never said y'all didn't have the materials to do so. So she proceeds to show my thicker bars but still not what I initially went there to get. I'm telling her like noo, this not what I wanted.  She asks if I want anything else because they don't do refunds. So I came and paid 70 dollars under the assumption I would get what I wanted, they didn't have it and I couldn't get a refund. MINUS ONE STAR.  So I tell her I'll wait while my sister gets hers done first because I was upset. She got ready to do my sisters. The dots she placed on my sisters tongue were symmetrical  and even, BUT once she pierced her tongue we both instantly noticed it was more so to the left, way left, then the center of her tongue. My sister said she was fine with it. Cool. So I got back in the chair to get mines. I wasn't about to waste 70 bucks. ALSO I FEEL A CUSTOMER SHOULD NOT PAY FOR A SERVICE BEFORE THEY GET IT DONE ! Seeing as how there are no refunds, which I was told after the fact, and then lied about being able to do what I wanted. Anyways, I get in the chair. She is drawing the dots on my tongue and had to mark my tongue like 3-4 times because then we're not even. When she finally gets it even and placed in the middle. Let me say the ink taste terrible! She proceeds to pierce and I can feel as soon as the needle went in and was not near the middle of my tongue. IMMEDIATELY I notice my Piercing is to the left of my tongue also. So I'm irritated all over again. I kept trying to show her how it wasn't in the middle and she says"it's just the way you holding your tongue." Lmao, this was horrible! So I continue to tell her it's not in the middle and she tells me we can take it out and redo it and I'm like fine. She then Says "well not right now I have other appointments coming."
Like NO you should finish with the appointment you already are in and I PAID ! So I leave and then I decided hell no. I'm getting this redone. I go back and she tells me to come back at 4. Two hours later. Cool.
I come back. Have to wait like 30 min. She finally calls be back to redo it. I'm showing her how it's NOT in the middle. The second time hurt like HELL because my tongue was already starting to swell from the first go round. She gets it in a much better position this time. It's closer to middle but VERY slanted. I said thanks and it looks MUCH better then before because it honestly does and I left. My sister wanted hers done over but she saw how painful mines was and neither of us should not have even had to go thru that. It should've been right the first time AND we should've got what we originally came for. So now my tongue is 2x swollen and sore because it had to go thru the trauma  twice ! Her hands were also shakey and normally when people pierce something like a tongue, they stand in front of you. Instead she was on the side which might have been the reason for them being sideways. Like I stated. The place was very clean and had a cool vibe. I just had a bad experience.

The guy that was there was very rude and immediately defensive as if I was accusing him of something.  I understand I wasn’t a paying customer and he had not done the piercing however a little bit of hospitality would’ve been nice even if you couldn’t help with the issue.

resp.text: We didn't do the Piercings you are complaining about, that is why i was short with you. It's a Tattoo shop how nice do you expect us to be?

name: Amanda Whitlock
text: Tonight, I waited four hours for a four-line tattoo that I never received. If I could give zero stars, I would. I decided to come to Royal Spade after seeing a Facebook post about Friday the 13th tattoo specials. The Facebook post stated that they would be doing small 2-4 inch simple tattoo designs from 1-10pm and it specifically said Walk-In only. I arrived at the shop around 6:30pm and paid for my tattoo. At that point, there were five other people in the waiting area. As I waited, several other people came into the shop. I waited for a couple of hours as the people that came in before me got their tattoos done. At around 9:45, the receptionist called back people that arrived after I did. I was a little confused, so I went to the desk and asked the receptionist if I was next in line. She told me that there was one couple ahead of me but that I would be next after that. She asked what my tattoo was, and I told her it was the symbol for the air element, which was only a triangle with a line through it. She told me that she would try to squeeze me in next before the couple because my tattoo was so simple. At around 10:30, the couple that was ahead of me was called back. A few minutes later, another couple that arrived after me was called back. I went to the front desk and told the receptionist that I thought I was next. It was at this point that one of the tattoo artists came up and told me that they could not keep tattooing all night and that they could not accept walk-ins all night. I pointed out that people who arrived after me were called back, and that I had been there since 6:30pm. That is when he informed me that everyone that was called back had been in earlier that day and were told to come back later. I was dumbfounded that I was not told this once; not when I came in nor during the four-hour duration I spent waiting. I was not informed about any possibility that I would not be able to get my tattoo tonight until after I had been waiting four hours, and then was told that I could not get my tattoo. It also makes no sense to me why people could leave and come back for a special that was advertised as Walk-In only. I am extremely disappointed in the lack of organization and customer service of this shop and I would not wish this horrible experience on anyone.

resp.text: We already told you that we were sorry we cannot get to your tattoo, we were booked for the rest of the day. if you paid for your tattoo? you can come back for a refund tomorrow, but that's about it. we will not be able to help you with any other services in the future due to your lack of respect for us.
